alert.note: Alert for Erie (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:53AM EST until February 19 at 1:23AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. For the Huron River...including Milan...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Huron River Near Milan. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Flood waters over a foot deep in Franklin Flats. Huron River Valley Campground inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 20.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.0 feet on 07/12/1966. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM EST.
